course_title: Special Studies History of Art: Preservation of Sites
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Preservation strategies for cultural heritage sites are impacted by interdependent factors including socio-political context, economic circumstances, climate change, and natural disasters. Students will explore course topics through case studies, discussions, and workshop activities. Student will select world sites to investigate and will develop reports site-specific reports as well as a collaborative online presentation. 
Art History major with Museums Concentration: elective
Art History major/minor: makers & materials course)
course_description: Advanced seminars dealing with various specialized problems in the history of art from antiquity to modern times, such as individual artists, genres (e.g. portraiture, landscape); themes (e.g. theory, iconography); artistic movements and museum studies. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
sections: Class Nbr: 3589, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: Th 1-3:45p, Instructor: Stein/Dinneen, Status: Wait List
